messages.message:
so my understanding of our OCR:
It is always 1 input file generating 1 ibocr file. ibocr is in JSON format, the root level is a big JSON array. OCR by default stores each pageâ€™s scanned result as an item in the array.
Map Records manipulate the items in the array in the ibocr. So for example if you say the entire document is a record, Map Record will merge all items in the array. But it is still one ibocr file
Yes correct. The ibocr currently is an array of records. After Process File, each record represents a page
After map records, each entry of the IBOCR array will correspond to one record. So in the Document is a record case, there will be one record in the IBOCR
